diff_gtf.py - compute overlap between multiple gtf files¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id$
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Genomics Intervals Genesets GTF Comparison

Purpose¶

This script compares multiple set of gtf files. It computes the overlap between bases, exons and genes between each pair of gtf files.

If results from a previous run are present, existing pairs are not re-computed but simply echoed.

The output is a tab-separated table with counts for each pair of files being compared. The fields are:

Column Content
set Name of the set
ngenes_total number of genes in set
ngenes_ovl number of genes overlapping
ngenes_unique number of unique genes
nexons_total number of exons in set
nexons_ovl number of exons overlapping
nexons_unique number of unique exons
nbases_total number of bases in gene set
nbases_ovl number of bases overlapping
nbases_unique number of unique bases

Fields starting with a p are the corresponding percentage values.

Usage¶

For example:

python diff_gtf.py *.gtf.gz > out.tsv

To update results from a previous run, type:

python diff_gtf.py --update=out.tsv *.gtf.gz > new.tsv

Type:

python diff_gtf.py --help

for command line help.

Command line options¶

Usage: diff_gtf.py [options]

Options:
  --version             show program's version number and exit
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --no-usage            output help without usage information
  -s, --ignore-strand   ignore strand information [default=False].
  -u FILENAME_UPDATE, --update=FILENAME_UPDATE
                        if filename is given, previous results will be read
                        from there and only changed sets will be computed
                        [default=none].
  -p PATTERN_ID, --pattern-id=PATTERN_ID
                        pattern to convert a filename to an id
                        [default=(.*).gtf].
  -g, --only-genes      only output gene stats (includes gene lists)
                        [default=False].
  -v LOGLEVEL, --verbose=LOGLEVEL
                        loglevel [1]. The higher, the more output.
  --timeit=TIMEIT_FILE  store timeing information in file [none].
  --timeit-name=TIMEIT_NAME
                        name in timing file for this class of jobs [all].
  --timeit-header       add header for timing information [none].
  --random-seed=RANDOM_SEED
                        random seed to initialize number generator with
                        [none].
  -I FILE, --stdin=FILE
                        file to read stdin from [default = stdin].
  -L FILE, --log=FILE   file with logging information [default = stdout].
  -E FILE, --error=FILE
                        file with error information [default = stderr].
  -S FILE, --stdout=FILE
                        file where output is to go [default = stdout].
